pros: Great place to work. Wonderful people, most that have been here for years.

pros: Community owned hospital, taking care of your neighbors.

review_title: Not the place it used to be
pros: Nurses are hardworking, intelligent, and caring.
cons: Nurse to patient ratios are unacceptable. They ask you to risk your license to work in areas where you have no training and they provide none.

pros: Staff is extremely welcoming, knowledgeable, and friendly. Tons of collaboration within therapy!

pros: Helping patients who are in pain or in need.

review_title: I worked at the Rehab Facility, really loved it.
job_title: Physical Therapist PRN in Farmington, NM
pros: There is a great team of supportive coworkers who will help in any way they can.
cons: I really had no issues with them.

review_title: Great place to work but you earn it
job_title: FLIGHT PARAMEDIC/CCT PARAMEDIC in Tucson, AZ
pros: Flexible schedule, good people, good equipment
cons: Some people get lazy. No support from upper management

pros: Wide berth to practice how I want. Pleasant atmosphere.
cons: No loan reimbursement offered for my position

review_title: A great hospital to get experience
pros: Friendly and helpful staff. Everyone works as a team here; as a new grad nurse I feel supported beyond the extent that I would hope for anywhere.
cons: Staffing ratios can be a problem; the patient assignment load can be a bit overwhelming, especially as a new grad. There are days when I fear that my license is jeopardized due to the insane amount of work that is expected of floor nurses within a 12 hour shift.

pros: Staff I supervised was wonderful
cons: Management  was the most hateful, condescending, negative people have ever worked for. They were  bullying and  very rude and extremely unprofessional. Always cussed NEVER EVER said “good morning”. NEVER EVER any positive feedback or showed appreciation for going to the extra mile. If I could do this all over I would have never accepted am the job. Don’t waste your time working here.

pros: Management support, cardiac cath lab is awesome

review_title: A lot of autonomy but sometimes unsupported

review_title: Hires Travlers instead of taking care of local staff
pros: The only hospital in area
cons: CEO highest paid in state...nurses lowest paid

pros: Decent benefits and PTO, flexible schedule

pros: Wide variety of care positions with amazing opportunities to care for Native populations.
cons: Poor support for Nursing staff with limited opportunities to advance.

pros: Night shift differential is ok
cons: High nurse ratios, Sometimes 1-9,

review_title: A wonderful hospital to work for!
pros: I can speak for the childbirth center only.  Night shift is very team oriented.  They make you feel welcome.  The differentials are very good 3p-11p 15% and 11p-7a 25%.  They offer 3% yearly raise and 3% if you meet criteria to ReiN.  The health insurance is amazing!  49.50 bi weekly for a single employee and 119.50 bi-weekly for a family.  And co pays are cheap at 10.00 if you use in network!
cons: Low pay rates!  New grad pay was 22.75 just last year.  Not sure if it's the same since they finally gave a cost of living raise of 2.50.  2009 was their last cost of living raise and now it's 2016. Hopefully they will continue to have a cost of living raise every year now.

pros: Good health insurance. Equipment is pretty good, except in the ER, where many of the beds are broken.
cons: Employer stopped contributing to my retirement in April of this year while the CEO makes a million dollars a year. Sexual harassment is tolerated, possibly even condoned, and the complainant finds herself in an even more hostile work environment. The offender continues to work here despite multiple, legitimate complaints followed by an "investigation" that neither finds anything nor does anything to take this place out of its ancient ways. Pay raises have not occurred for a decade ... not even cost of living increases. Your annual evaluation does not cause your pay to increase or decrease.

review_title: Meets almost all of my expectations of what being a medical caregiver is all about!
pros: Patient care and satisfaction is the number one Priority!  They care about the staff as well, providing the little extras like a $50.00 quarterly bonus for perfect attendance, that lets you know you are appreciated too!
cons: Surrounding town, but they are working on improving and beautifying the area with the River walk just down the street from the hospital

review_title: It's all about who you know - lack of leadership
pros: On sight cafe and good benefits
cons: Being assessed "occurences" when family emergencies or sickness keeps you from going to work.  Reaching 8 occurrences with the threat of being fired at the 8th is ridiculous!  Supervisors pick and choose who to give the occurences to - all depends on who you know and a lot of butt kissing.

review_title: Good place to work, politics terrible
pros: Good benefits, free parking, decent cafeteria, many opportunities to transfer interdepartmentally, free gym, multi cultural environment
cons: nurse bullying by other nurses, management weak and does not address the problems such as low morale that this creates. Employees encouraged to "snitch" on each other and then rewarded for such behavior, favoritism , and management turns a blind eye to legitimate issues. Bottom line is all that matters. Non union.

pros: Clean, comfortable physical work environment with many educational opportunities. Benefits offered and wages are among the best in the industry,
cons: Employee confidence and trust in management is lacking, Different expectations exist and vary between departments and one employee to another, For example: written attendance policy is often changed to suit some employees and overtime and holiday schedules are unfairly distributed. I worked in the same department foe over eleven years and saw six different managers,

job_title: Staff Psychologist in San Juan, PR
pros:
Wide range of clinical opportunities working in a varied healthcare enviroment. 
Psychologist contribution to the clinical team of professionals is often appreciated and valued.
Steady working hours allows for one to carry a private practice after tour of duty ends.
Salary and Benefits packages are on the top of the spectrum in our island's economy.
cons:
This is an organization that wants to move along and change with it's times yet it carries heavy residuals of it's past. 
Organizational opportunities for growth are limited.

review_title: NOT RECOMMENDED TO WORK IN! RUN!! Or you'll turn PSYCHoo and be admitted.
pros: PROs: Camaradere and team work among staff, okay benefits, there are ALWAYS job openings due to fast turnovers, experience so you can move on to a real job, a pretty hospital, decent cafeteria food
cons:
For the few years I worked here, there were a lot of staff turnovers. The common knowledge was that, they were let loose. I ran as fast as I could as I felt like I was next on the chopping block. I felt like I was targeted, like my ex-colleagues. And I just got out right in time. Another one was fired, months after I left. 

At staff meetings, suggestions by staff are rudely denied by manager. Meetings often focused on staff who made mistake, embarrassing them and when someone dares to defend the person being bullied, he himself is also criticized. 

When an issue is brought to the attention of the manager or even up to the higher ups, employee will be seen as trouble-maker and the administration will be watching your every move waiting for you to make a mistake, then threaten to or "hint on" firing you.

Even after a year of leaving, my colleagues, who are still working there are asking me to write a letter telling how I was harassed, to support them on their rally against the manager and are AGAIN filing a complaint to the higher ups.

Lots of Nepotism too, especially in the administration (bestfriends slash neighbors, cousins, daughter-in-laws to father-in-laws, mother-daughter), thus workplace unfair politics and favoritism.

You have been warned.


CONs: Non-union workplace, Politics, PASSIVE-AGGRESSIVE UNIT MANAGER, NEPOTISM thus favoritism, the upper administration protecting their own, disgruntled coworkers, ridiculous salary ($20/hr newgrad RN), no job securilty

review_title: I Love San Juan Regonal Hosptal and most of all the patients.
pros: The Staff was great to work with. I do miss it here. would still be there if I didn't have to move for my husbands job.
cons: Like at most places, upper management only cares about the bottom line.

review_title: SJRMC has been a good  place to work over the past 20 years.
pros: Compensation and benefits are very good. Moderately sized hospital allows for transfer within departments and many career choices for all health care personnel.
cons: Too many layers of management doesn't allow for transparency of troubled departments. Lots of politics within this hospital are ignored.

pros: Great people to work with.  Manager and supervisors were always willing to provide guidance, education, and mentoring when necessary.
cons: For me, it was commute time.  SJRMC serves a wide rural area, and my commute was 2+ hours each way.

pros: Out door life in this area is great
cons: ETOH epidemic, no structure to staff patient ratio. Free for all on patient assignments. Some nurse take one an hour others take 5-6. Burn out rate is rampant. Pay/benefits recently got cut. Bullying is an issue. Favoritism is obvious. ER Nurse make the same amount as other floors and work way harder at much faster pace.

review_title: Has the potential to be better
pros: Great Insurance plan, low deductibles.
cons:
No communication among departments or faculty
Many long term employees who hold on to knowledge for dear life, won't share
